text: A20 negatively regulates IAV - induced gene expression in BMDM
To investigate the role of A20 in the IAV - induced proinflammatory and antiviral innate immune responses , we infected A20 deficient and control BMDM with IAV X-47 ( H3N2 ) .
A20 mRNA levels were rapidly induced in wild type BMDM , but not in A20 deficient BMDM , upon viral infection ( figure 2A ) .

Furthermore , A20myel-KO BMDM show enhanced expression of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFNbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA after IAV infection compared to control cells ( figure 2A ) .

In accordance with these data , cell culture supernatant collected from these cells contained higher levels of <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFNbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( figure 2B ) .
Upon host infection with IAV , alveolar macrophages are an important source of cytokines and chemokines , attracting innate immune cells to the lung during the primary phase of infection .

To test whether A20 directly controls IAV - induced gene expression in alveolar macrophages , we isolated these cells from lungs of A20myel-KO and control littermates and infected them in vitro with IAV X-47 .

Expression and secretion of the proinflammatory cytokines <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the type-I IFN <extra_id_0> IFNbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFNalpha4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the chemokines <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ccl2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> KC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> cxcl1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) was significantly higher in IAV infected cells lacking A20 compared to infected wild type cells ( figure 2C and figure S1 ) .

Taken together these results demonstrate that A20 negatively regulates IAV - induced proinflammatory and antiviral gene expression in alveolar macrophages , consistent with the inhibitory effect of A20 seen on <extra_id_0> RIG-I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced NF-kappaB and <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation .
